hypothesis_content.title: MSTR Extreme Premium/Discount to NAV Reversion
hypothesis_content.statement: MicroStrategy (MSTR) stock price, as a Bitcoin proxy, exhibits mean reversion when its premium/discount to its Bitcoin holdings Net Asset Value (NAV) reaches an extreme (>+25% premium or <-10% discount). A reversion toward the 30-day average premium/discount occurs within 10 trading days with >67% probability, independent of the broader crypto regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: MSTR's primary value is its BTC holdings. Extreme premiums invite arbitrage (e.g., short MSTR, long BTC spot/futures). Extreme discounts may signal market inefficiency or temporary fear, attracting value-oriented buyers. The 30-day average premium represents a perceived 'fair' market pricing for the corporate structure and management premium/discount.
entry_conditions: MSTR_Premium > 0.25 (short MSTR/long BTC) OR MSTR_Premium < -0.10 (long MSTR/short BTC)
Current premium is >2 standard deviations from its 30-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: Premium returns to within 0.5 standard deviations of its 30-day average
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Premium expands by an additional 50% of the initial extreme (e.g., from +25% to +37.5%)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The hypothesis is falsified if the extreme premium/discount persists or widens in more than 40% of cases, indicating a structural shift in how the market values the MSTR vehicle versus direct BTC exposure.
